clinical_study.brief_title: Desflurane Versus Total Intravenous Anesthesia in Ophthalmic Ambulatory Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Of Desflurane Balanced Anesthesia Versus Total Intravenous Anesthesia in Patients Undergoing Ophthalmic Ambulatory Surgery: A Single Center, Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, randomized, prospective research which aims to investigate the advantages and disadvantages between desflurane balanced anesthesia and TIVA in ophthalmic ambulatory surgery, so that to evaluate a better anesthesia method in ophthalmic surgery through a large sample clinical study.

detailed_description.textblock: Desflurane balanced anesthesia and total intravenous anesthesia(TIVA) are commonly used in ambulatory surgery, however, there was no clear evidence to discriminate the advantages and disadvantages between desflurane anesthesia and TIVA when used in ophthalmic ambulatory surgery. This study is designed to evaluate a better anesthesia method in ophthalmic surgery through a clinical study. This is a singlecenter, randomized, prospective study. 200 adult patients undergoing ophthalmic ambulatory surgery are enrolled in this study, and the patients are randomly and equally divided into two groups: Group TIVA(TIVA with propofol) and Group Des(desflurane).Group TIVA is maintained with propofol 50~150μg/kg/min,and remifentanil 0.1~0.5μg/kg/min, while group Des is maintained with desflurane ranged from 0.5~1.5 MAC. Both groups of patients' bispectral index(BIS) values are maintained at 40~60 intraoperatively. The primary outcome is awake time, the secondary outcomes include the stay time in the postoperative care unit, discharge time, incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV), incidence of postoperative agitation, quality of recovery in 1 day postoperatively, as well as anesthesia cost,etc.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the ending time of anesthesia until the recovery time of patient's consciousness, assessed up to half an hour postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: "Anesthesia ends" means stop infusing or inhaling any anaesthetic.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the ending time of anesthesia until the time of extubation, assessed up to half an hour postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: The standards of extubation are tidal volume(VT) 6～8 ml/kg，respiratory rate(RR) 10～12 times per minute，end-tidal carbon dioxide (ETCO2) 35～45 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stay time in the postoperative care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measuring the stay time in postoperative care unit, assessed up to one hour postoperatively.

secondary_outcome.description: It will use telephone follow-up for the patients enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-60 years patients undergoing selective ophthalmic ambulatory surgery；
- ASA I and II
- duration of anesthesia at least 30min
- without apparent organ comorbidities
- sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- equal or greater than ASA III
- has a history of dementia，psychiatric disorders or central nervous system diseases
- taking sedatives, antidepressant or glucocorticoid
- without family members
- has cardiac, respiratory，liver，kidney comorbidities
- uncontrolled hypertension（>180/100mmHg）
- laryngeal mask fail to insert, and change to tracheal intubation
